newsitem.title: UK: Shell gains on upbeat upstream presentation.
newsitem.headline: Shell gains on upbeat upstream presentation.

text.p: Shares in Shell Transport and Trading Co Plc pushed ahead on Friday following an upbeat presentation to analysts in Amsterdam yesterday, analysts said.
"They gave a bullish presentation on their global upstream exploration and production operations," said ABN AMRO Hoare Govett oil and gas analyst John Besant-Jones.

"People had been thinking that forecasts were too low anyway because of a restructuring in Shell's downstream operations and now they have an upbeat upstream story too. It appears that Shell is undergoing a corporate sea change," said Besant-Jones.
He said forecasts will be upgraded by 5-10 percent. Estimates range from about 5.7 billion to 6.3 billion for 1997 and between about 6.2 billion to 6.9 billion for 1998.
Shell executives are giving a further presentation to analysts in New York today.
